greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p if e >= p, otherwise 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p if e >= p, otherwise 1.
example: For n = 12 = 2^2 * 3^1, only prime factor p = 2 satisfies p^p | 12, thus a(12) = 2.
For n = 108 = 2^2 * 3^3, both prime factors p = 2 and p = 3 satisfy p^p | 108, thus a(108) = 2*3 = 6.
mathematica: Array[Apply[Times, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; IntegerQ@ p :> If[e >= p, p, 1]] &, 120] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 01 2019 *)
program: (PARI) A327936(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(k=1, #f~, f[k,2] = (f[k,2]>=f[k,1])); factorback(f); };
xref: Differs from A129252 for the first time at n=108.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 01 2019
